column2: Abbott in talks to sell its eye-surgery business to J&J; - WSJBRIEF-Abbott to sell Abbott Medical Optics to Johnson & Johnson for $4.325 blnUPDATE 3-Abbott to sell its eye care business to J&J; for about $4.33 bln Sept 16 Abbott Laboratories said it would sell its eye care business to Johnson & Johnson  for about $4.33 billion in cash to focus on cardiovascular devices and diagnostics business.  UPDATE 3-Abbott to sell its eye care business to J&J; for about $4.33 bln Sept 16 Abbott Laboratories said it would sell its eye care business to Johnson & Johnson  for about $4.33 billion in cash to focus on cardiovascular devices and diagnostics business. * Net impact of this transaction is not expected to impact Abbott's overall targeted ongoing earnings per share in 2017.UPDATE 3-Abbott to sell its eye care business to J&J; for about $4.33 bln Sept 16 Abbott Laboratories said it would sell its eye care business to Johnson & Johnson  for about $4.33 billion in cash to focus on cardiovascular devices and diagnostics business.   BRIEF-Abbott to sell Abbott Medical Optics to Johnson & Johnson for $4.325 blnUPDATE 3-Abbott to sell its eye care business to J&J; for about $4.33 bln Sept 16 Abbott Laboratories said it would sell its eye care business to Johnson & Johnson  for about $4.33 billion in cash to focus on cardiovascular devices and diagnostics business.  UPDATE 3-Abbott to sell its eye care business to J&J; for about $4.33 bln Sept 16 Abbott Laboratories said it would sell its eye care business to Johnson & Johnson  for about $4.33 billion in cash to focus on cardiovascular devices and diagnostics business. * Net impact of this transaction is not expected to impact Abbott's overall targeted ongoing earnings per share in 2017.UPDATE 3-Abbott to sell its eye care business to J&J; for about $4.33 bln Sept 16 Abbott Laboratories said it would sell its eye care business to Johnson & Johnson  for about $4.33 billion in cash to focus on cardiovascular devices and diagnostics business.  Sept 16 Abbott Laboratories is in talks to sell its eye-surgery business to Johnson & Johnson
column4: citing sources familiar with the matter.BRIEF-Abbott to sell Abbott Medical Optics to Johnson & Johnson for $4.325 blnUPDATE 3-Abbott to sell its eye care business to J&J; for about $4.33 bln Sept 16 Abbott Laboratories said it would sell its eye care business to Johnson & Johnson  for about $4.33 billion in cash to focus on cardiovascular devices and diagnostics business.  UPDATE 3-Abbott to sell its eye care business to J&J; for about $4.33 bln Sept 16 Abbott Laboratories said it would sell its eye care business to Johnson & Johnson  for about $4.33 billion in cash to focus on cardiovascular devices and diagnostics business. * Net impact of this transaction is not expected to impact Abbott's overall targeted ongoing earnings per share in 2017.UPDATE 3-Abbott to sell its eye care business to J&J; for about $4.33 bln Sept 16 Abbott Laboratories said it would sell its eye care business to Johnson & Johnson  for about $4.33 billion in cash to focus on cardiovascular devices and diagnostics business.

column2: Abbott in talks to sell its eye-surgery business to J&J; - WSJBRIEF-Johnson & Johnson to buy Abbott Medical Optics for $4.325 blnBRIEF-Abbott to sell Abbott Medical Optics to Johnson & Johnson for $4.325 blnUPDATE 3-Abbott to sell its eye care business to J&J; for about $4.33 bln Sept 16 Abbott Laboratories said it would sell its eye care business to Johnson & Johnson  for about $4.33 billion in cash to focus on cardiovascular devices and diagnostics business.  UPDATE 3-Abbott to sell its eye care business to J&J; for about $4.33 bln Sept 16 Abbott Laboratories said it would sell its eye care business to Johnson & Johnson  for about $4.33 billion in cash to focus on cardiovascular devices and diagnostics business. * Net impact of this transaction is not expected to impact Abbott's overall targeted ongoing earnings per share in 2017.UPDATE 3-Abbott to sell its eye care business to J&J; for about $4.33 bln Sept 16 Abbott Laboratories said it would sell its eye care business to Johnson & Johnson  for about $4.33 billion in cash to focus on cardiovascular devices and diagnostics business. Target urges employees to help turn around performance ahead of holidays MINNEAPOLIS
column3: Sept 15 Target Corp Chief Executive Brian Cornell on Thursday urged the company's employees to focus on delivering a better in-store and online experience for shoppers in an attempt to turnaround its performance before the crucial holiday season.

UPS,Sensing threat, UPS plans to expand its 3D printing operations LOUISVILLE, Ky., Sept 16 United Parcel Service  plans to expand its 3D printing service to Asia and Europe, the U.S. shipping company has told Reuters, in a bid to fully embrace and get ahead of a trend that threatens to eat away a small but lucrative part of its business.
